gameRecap.title: Game Recap: Cavaliers 111, Nets 102
gameRecap.excerpt: Led by Donovan Mitchell's season-high 45 points (21 in the 4th quarter), the Cavaliers defeated the Nets, 111-102, in the 2024 Paris Game. Mitchell added 12 rebounds, six assists and four steals for the Cavaliers, while Jarrett Allen recorded his eighth straight game with a double-double, notching 12 points, 12 rebounds and four blocks in the victory. Mikal Bridges (26 points, six rebounds) and Cam Thomas (26 points, six rebounds) combined for 52 points for the Nets in the losing effort. The Cavaliers have won their fourth straight game as they improve to 22-15 on the season, while the Nets fall to 16-22.
